revised_title: Selective Absorption of Ketones: A New Theory of Intramolecular Vibrations
tldr: The authors studied the selective absorption of ketones and found that it is caused by intramolecular vibrations due to the formation and breaking down of unstable ring systems. They suggest that free partial valencies, which can appear on atoms linked by a double bond, play a role in this process. This theory explains the selective absorption exhibited by various ketones and their derivatives.
